Articles.Content: I started thinking about Kerbals being dwarves from Dwarf Fortress. Ya know, being short, living underground, overengineering, dangerous solutions, !!SCIENCE!!, unhappiness from minor things, stupidity. What do you think about it?

Every fantasy dwarf is like this, not only the ones from Dwarf Fortress.

You should play tabletop RPGs more often.

There are a lot of different dwarves in fantasy. Consider just the different stereotypes Tolkien used:

  • Somewhat evil beings from Norse folklore.
  • Comic reliefs.
  • Jews as perceived by Europeans before the 20th century.
  • Miners, builders, and engineers without peer.

I don't really associate stupidity, overengineering, and dangerous solutions with fantasy dwarves. For me, they're characteristics of Dragonlance gnomes.
Ture, but the fortress dwarves are much more eccentric. although the Dwarves in the RA Salvator books are for the most part normal, they just curse and drink a bit more than humans.
